target_paper.title: Jovanovic et al. 2021 (part I)
target_paper.objective_summary: The main research objective of Jovanovic et al. (2021) is to explore the concepts and origins of characteristic times in microscale-based chemical and biochemical processes. The research approach involves a comprehensive time scale analysis to understand the underlying mechanisms and factors influencing these processes at a microscale level.

comparisons.reasoning:
1. objectives: the objectives of the two papers are significantly different. paper a focuses on exploring the concepts and origins of characteristic times in microscale-based chemical and biochemical processes, while paper b aims to develop a high h2s-tolerant biological system for cell cultivation and conversion of methane to methanol under high levels of h2s stress.

2. methods: the research approaches in the two papers are also distinct. paper a employs a comprehensive time scale analysis to understand the underlying mechanisms and factors influencing microscale processes. in contrast, paper b involves enriching a methanotrophic consortium from anaerobic digester effluent under high h2s stress and studying the effects of various factors on cell growth and conversion efficiency.

3. claims: the claims made in the two papers are unrelated. paper a does not make any specific claims about the development of a biological system or the conversion of methane to methanol. instead, it focuses on understanding the characteristic times in microscale-based processes. paper b, on the other hand, claims to have developed a high h2s-tolerant biological system for the conversion of methane to methanol under high h2s stress.

in conclusion, the two papers have low similarity due to their different objectives, methods, and claims.
